page.title: 09BIRDS OF PREY-1
page.content: In Strathnairn we have lots of birds of prey,we have the{golden eagle, {buzzard,sparrowhawk,osprey,peregrine {falcon,kestrel,barn owl,long eared owl {and short eared owl}nesting around the area. {Golden eagle The golden eagle eats mammals to the size of a fawn.They live about 50 feet of the ground but have been seen nesting in bushes.Some think a sheep might jump down on a grassy ledge then an eagle comes along and screams.This makes the sheep jump off the edge then the eagle can eat. {Osprey The osprey nests near water in pine forests and feeds on fish up to 14 pounds or more.The female lays 2_4 white eggs heavily marked with brown. They have big and powerful tallons to catch the big fish to feed the chicks.
